DOC.brief_summary: Study type : Randomized Control Treatment Trial Study population : Male female patient ≥15 year age acute scrub typhus Duration : 2 year Study Design : Prospective , open-label , randomized-controlled treatment trial patient ≥15 year old admit hospital acute scrub typhus . Randomization 3 oral treatment arm ( n=59 patient , total n=177 ) : ) 7 day doxycycline , ii ) 3 day doxycycline , iii ) 3 day azithromycin Primary Objective : To evaluate clinical microbiological response scrub typhus patient three oral treatment regimen : 7 day doxycycline , 3 day doxycycline , 3 day azithromycin Secondary Objectives : 1 . To perform pharmacokinetic/pharmacodynamics ( PK/PD ) characterization therapeutic response doxycycline azithromycin , incl . serial bacterial load measurement . 2 . To define clinical , bacterial , pathophysiological pharmacological factor associate disease severity , fever-clearance time ( FCT ) , treatment failure relapse/re-infection . 3 . To determine minimum inhibitory concentration ( MIC ) clinical Orientia tsutsugamushi isolate doxycycline , azithromycin chloramphenicol , use vitro growth-inhibition assay 4 . To genotype clinical isolates use whole genome sequence comparative genomics . 5 . To dissect natural immune response scrub typhus , use antigen-specific cellular immune antibody study , cytokine profiling
